title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.5 - Unsatisfied judgment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.5 - Unsatisfied judgment

State Regulations

Where a certified copy of a judgment is received by the
department with an affirmation that it remains unsatisfied in accordance with
section
332
of
the Vehicle and Traffic Law, a suspension of all registrations and the driver's
license and/or driving privilege of the judgment debtor shall be issued. Upon
receipt by the department of satisfactory documentation that such judgment has
been satisfied, stayed, vacated, reversed, or that the court in which the
judgement was rendered has permitted payments in installments, the suspension
shall be terminated, and a notice of restoration shall be issued. If a notice
of default in installment payments is received, the suspension order shall be
reinstated. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
35.5

Amended

New

York State Register April 26, 2017 /Volume XXXIX, Issue 17, eff. 4/26/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
